DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Rib Sternum Clavicle Chest Performed Curie Extension Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The curie extension score to indicate the quantity of metastases on the rib, sternum, clavicle and chest diagnostic image.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Rib Sternum Clavicle Chest Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.:Any one of the paired bones, 12 on either side, extending from the thoracic vertebrae toward the median line on the ventral aspect of the trunk. The long curved bones which form the rib cage. Generally, ribs 1 to 7 are connected to the sternum by their costal cartilages and are called true ribs, whereas ribs 8 to 12 are termed false ribs._The long, flat bone connecting with the cartilages of the first seven ribs and the clavicle._One of a pair of bones linking the scapula and the sternum. The clavicle is part of the pectoral girdle._The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any one of the paired bones, 12 on either side, extending from the thoracic vertebrae toward the median line on the ventral aspect of the trunk. The long curved bones which form the rib cage. Generally, ribs 1 to 7 are connected to the sternum by their costal cartilages and are called true ribs, whereas ribs 8 to 12 are termed false ribs._The long, flat bone connecting with the cartilages of the first seven ribs and the clavicle._One of a pair of bones linking the scapula and the sternum. The clavicle is part of the pectoral girdle._The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction._Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: Any one of the paired bones, 12 on either side, extending from the thoracic vertebrae toward the median line on the ventral aspect of the trunk. The long curved bones which form the rib cage. Generally, ribs 1 to 7 are connected to the sternum by their costal cartilages and are called true ribs, whereas ribs 8 to 12 are termed false ribs.
The long, flat bone connecting with the cartilages of the first seven ribs and the clavicle.
One of a pair of bones linking the scapula and the sternum. The clavicle is part of the pectoral girdle.

The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A score assigned to a Curie body segment to indicate the quantity of metastases._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No metastatic sites within a segment.

Concepts.definition: No metastatic sites within a segment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One metastatic site within a segment.

Concepts.definition: One metastatic site within a segment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: More than one metastatic site within a segment.

Concepts.definition: More than one metastatic site within a segment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Diffuse involvement within a segment (>50% of the segment).

Concepts.definition: Diffuse involvement within a segment (>50% of the segment).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A score assigned to a Curie body segment to indicate the quantity of metastases.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
